question_text:
Question
 48
A waste to energy plant burns dry solid waste of composition: Carbon = 35%, Oxygen = 26%, Hydrogen 
= 10%, Sulphur = 6%, Nitrogen = 3% and Inerts = 20%. Burning rate is 1000 tonnes/d .Oxygen in air by 
weight is 23%. Assume complete conversion of Carbon to 
2
CO
 , Hydrogen to 
2
H O
 , Sulphur to 
2
SO
  and
Nitrogen to 
2
NO
Given Atomic weight: H = 1, C = 12, N = 14, O = 16, S = 32
The stoichiometric (theoretical) amount of air (in tonnes/d
, round off to the nearest integer
) required for 
complete burning of this waste, is ______.
